chariot 1.2.1
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Join a dataframe object with the Concept Table

leftJoinConcept.Rd

This function has better performance than the WHERE IN statement for larger searches. A table in the format of "vunpunctuated timestamp" is written to the local Athena. A join is performed with a concept table. The table is subsequently dropped. If a dataframe column is not provided as a the column to join the concept table on, the 1st column will be used by default.

leftJoinConcept(
  .data,
  column = NULL,
  athena_schema = "public",
  concept_column = "concept_id",
  synonyms = FALSE,
  verbose = FALSE,
  conn = NULL,
  render_sql = FALSE,
  sleepTime = 1,
  ...
)

Arguments

.data

A data frame
column

Data frame column that the join will be performed on. If NULL, defaults to the column in position 1 of the data frame.
athena_schema

Schema of the OMOP Concept Table
concept_column

Column in the concept
verbose

If TRUE, prints whether the cache is being loaded or being actively queried in the Postgres database, Default: FALSE
conn

Connection object if another database is used. Default: NULL
render_sql

If TRUE, will print the SQL to the console before executing. Default: FALSE
sleepTime

Argument in seconds passed to the `Sys.sleep()` function at the end of query, Default: 1
...

Additional arguments passed to the `queryAthena()` function.

Value

A data frame

See also

select,filter,mutate-joins group_by_unique_aggregate
